hanzi-su-wiki:
縄

Значения

Верёвка, канат

Мнемоника

Лучший материал для прочных канатов 糸 — осока, в зарослях которой водятся жабы 黽.

Варианты

繩, 绳
purpleculture_pinyin:
shéng
Japanese variant of 绳
Японский вариант 绳
rtega_mnemonic:
縄縄RS
X		rope
  • made of threads 糸 and resembling the back of a frog
索 綱 維 繩

繩繩RS
縄縄		rope, string, cord, control
  • rope 糸 used for endeavours 黽
  • thread 糸 thick like the tail of a frog 黽
heisig_constituent: straw rope, thread, spiderman, eels, sun, day
koohiiStory1: The tortoise has escaped! We tied it up with a straw rope, but all that´s left of the rope are some torn threads, and the unbound tortoise is nowhere to be found. (Note that the right half here is not "eels". This is (in my opinion) a mistake in the RTK book, as we already decided in waterfall (#537) to refer to the simplified form of dragon as "eels". It is much better to call the right half of this character an "unbound tortoise".).
koohiiStory2: When Spiderman fights the giant tortoise, he grabs a straw rope from the edges of the sumo ring and swings it at his head. However, the tortoise quickly tucks his head back into his shell to avoid the blow (hence no head on the tortoise).
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Someone threaded a turtle into long skinny pieces, making a rope.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: A rope made of threaded turtles. Go ahead and grab onto it and see how it feels. A little rough, but strong.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The person making these threaded turtle ropes is the local giant farmhand Jourm (じょう). You watch him stretch and peel pieces of turtle off of turtles, then thread them together into a rope.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Besides being awful, where did Jourm learn to thread turtles into ropes? Why does he have so many turtles despite living on such an inland farm? These are nice ropes that Jourm is making though, and you kind of want to buy some.
Ru_Radicals: 乙 (второй), 勹 (обёртка), 小 (маленький), 幺 (короткая нить), 田 (рисовое поле), 糸 (нить), 亀 (черепаха)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the thread (糸) like a turtle (亀) with no corner (⺈) is a rope

Name meaning

shéng
яп. вм. 绳
Radicals: 糸, 亀  (thread, turtle)
Meaning Mnemonic
Someone threaded a turtle into long skinny pieces, making a rope.
A rope made of threaded turtles. Go ahead and grab onto it and see how it feels. A little rough, but strong.
Reading Mnemonic
The person making these threaded turtle ropes is the local giant farmhand Jourm (じょう). You watch him stretch and peel pieces of turtle off of turtles, then thread them together into a rope.
Besides being awful, where did Jourm learn to thread turtles into ropes? Why does he have so many turtles despite living on such an inland farm? These are nice ropes that Jourm is making though, and you kind of want to buy some.
